jsonSchema.title: JSON Schema for App Mgmt / Enterprise Query (Data Quality Rules)
jsonSchema.description: Describes the expected JSON structure for the AppMgmtWithEnterpriseDetails query and includes data quality rules for application ownership and management. The following rules apply: (1) Applications in PRODUCTION or DEPRECATED status must have an owner; (2) Application owners must have ACTIVE status; (3) Owner's department must match the application's department; (4) Application owners must be employees, not contractors.

appManagementInfo.description: Information about App Management applications, including nested Enterprise owner and department details.

applicationOwner.description: Details about an enterprise associate (linked from App Mgmt).

enterpriseDepartmentId.description: Rule 3: The owner's department must match the application's department. Cross-departmental ownership is not permitted to ensure proper accountability and alignment.

status.description: Rule 2: Every application owner must have an ACTIVE status. Inactive or terminated employees cannot be assigned as application owners.

relationshipType.description: Rule 4: Every application that is in PRODUCTION or DEPRECATED must have an owner with relationship type EMPLOYEE. Contractors or other non-employee associates cannot be assigned as application owners.

department.description: Details about an enterprise department (linked from App Mgmt).

allOf.description: Rule 1: Every application that is in PRODUCTION or DEPRECATED must have an owner. Applications without an assigned owner are considered non-compliant.

query:
# Sample GraphQL query demonstrating cross-schema data retrieval
# Fetches App Management application details and nests related
# owner and department information from the Enterprise domain.

query app_mgmt_applications {

  appManagementInfo: appMgmtApplications { # Removed limit
    # App_Mgmt fields
    appMgmtApplicationId
    applicationName
    applicationType
    lifecycleStatus
    version
    description

    # Nested Enterprise_EnterpriseAssociates data
    applicationOwner {
      enterpriseAssociateId
      firstName
      lastName
      email
      jobTitle
      enterpriseDepartmentId # Added field
      status               # Added field
      relationshipType
    }

    # Nested Enterprise_EnterpriseDepartments data
    department {
      enterpriseDepartmentId
      departmentName
      operatingUnit
    }
  }
}
